projects.title: Wordle Clone
projects.one_line: Created a clone of the game Wordle. My clone allows users to guess words of length 4-7.

projects.title: Chat Application
projects.one_line: Created a Full-Stack Chat Application using RESTful API endpoints and Sockets for instant messaging. Designed & implemented a database to hold users, messages and chats using PostgreSQL. Use of PyTest & Robot Framework for both unit and integration testing. Created a GUI client in React and command client in Go.

projects.title: Dissertation: Human Activity Tracking using Smartphones
projects.one_line: This project focuses on the recognition of activities of daily life (ADLs) and uses Convolutional Neural Networks (CNNs) and Long Short-Term Memory (LSTMs) models to predict activity types from smartphone sensors, such as accelerometers and gyroscopes. Created Activity Monitoring & Fall Detection applications which track a user’s activity & automatically calls a emergency contact when a user has fallen.

projects.title: User Interface Evaluation & Redesign
projects.one_line: Performed an evaluation of a prototype user interface (UI) against a set of usability guidelines. The UI was then redesigned to improve its usability.

projects.title: Big Data Analytics
projects.one_line: Tasked with implementing various analytics queries using Hadoop MapReduce and Apache Hive. The efficiency, usability and scalability of each framework is then compared.

projects.title: Delay Tolerant Network Analysis
projects.category: Module: CS345 – Sensor Networks & Mobile Comms
projects.one_line: Tasked with investigating how the distance & speed of a mobile node affect the number of packets successfully delivered to stationary nodes.

projects.title: TETRIS Game
projects.one_line: Tasked with creating a playable version of the classic Tetris game using WebGl and JavaScript, including features such as piece look-ahead, a scoring system and levels of difficulty. The program created uses WebGL, utilising a fragment and vertex shader

projects.title: Multi-Class Classifier
projects.one_line: Designing and training a multi-class perceptron to classify types of flowers from the Iris Dataset. This used a perceptron classifier, generated by applying a kernel-based latent factor model to the original data set.

projects.title: Portfolio Website (V2)
projects.one_line: A React based Portfolio Website. All data is stored and pulled from JSON files for ease of maintainability.

projects.title: Angular Weather App
projects.one_line: An Angular Based Weather App which uses the OpenWeather API to fetch weather data. Includes unit tests.

projects.title: PLM Program Parser & Lexer
projects.one_line: Parsed & evaluated Programming Language of the Moment (PLM). This allowed for assignments & functions.

projects.title: Derivative Trade Reporting & Analytical Tool
projects.one_line: A tool which uses machine learning to analyse and report derivative trade data. Part of 2nd Year Group Project.
info: In this group project (Sponsored by Deutsche Bank), we were tasked with creating a derivative trade reporting and analytical tool.
Our project was able to add, edit and delete derivate trade and currency data, in additon to using Machine Learning to find ‘fat-finger’ errors and other inconsistencies in the data over time.
For this project, we used Python with the Flask Web framework along in combination with isolation forest used in the machine learning.

projects.title: Timetable Scheduler
projects.one_line: Given a list of modules, tutors & constraints this project uses a backtracking algorithm to produce an accepted timetable.
info: In this project, I created a Timetable Scheduler which will schedule a given a set of modules and lab sessions on weekdays with a given number of slots, ensuring the sessions are scheduled in the most cost-effective way.
This is an example of a solution to a constraint satisfaction problem and uses backtracking in addition to a MRV ordering heuristic to find the best solution.

projects.title: Multi-Threaded Packet Sniffer
projects.category: Module: CS241 – Computer Networks & Operating Systems
projects.one_line: A Packet sniffer which detects & analyses Ethernet, ARP, IPv4 and TCP packets whilst detecting intrusions such as SYN, ARP poisoning attacks and blacklisted URLs.
info: In this task, I created a Packet sniffer that can detect and analyse Ethernet, ARP, IPv4 and TCP packets written in C. In addition, the program can also detect intrusions such as: SYN attacks, ARP poisoning and blacklisted URLs.
Packets are analysed concurrently using a thread pool with a maximum of 10 threads.

projects.title: Department Store Database Analysis
projects.one_line: A Database System for a fictional department store, able to store the inventory, orders, collections, deliveries and staff.
info: In this task, I created a database system for a department store that stores the inventory, orders, collections, deliveries and staff.

Using JDBC, the system allows staff to create in-store purchases, collections and deliveries, review the biggest selling products, calculate staff life-time success, staff contribution and candidates for employee of the year all using SQL queries.
Input is carefully sanitised and validated before the SQL query is constructed.

projects.title: Scratch Clone
projects.one_line: A project which evaluates statements & instructions and updates and returns the state to user. Uses Haskell - Functional Programming Language.
info: This project involved writing a program in the functional programming language Haskell which evaluates statements and instructions, depending on the given state.
The program then updates and returns the state to user. Input included assignment, if statements and instructions to retrieve data from memory.
Additional functionality I implemented included while statements, repeat statements, Booleans and the factorial function.

projects.title: Mastermind
projects.one_line: An implementation of Donald Knuth's Algorithm for the familiar Mastermind Game. Written in Haskell.
info: This project involved writing specific functions in the Haskell to implement Donald Knuth's algorithm in the Mastermind game.
This algorithm has the ability to solve any four character codes in under 5 guesses.

projects.title: Witter
projects.category: Module: CS126 - Design of Information Structures
projects.one_line: A project which simulates the functionality of Twitter and involved storing and retrieving users, ‘Weets’, and followers. Hash tables and adjacency matrices were used to store and retrieve the data, ensuring a fast and efficient process.
info: This project simulated the basic functionality of Twitter and involved storing and retrieving users, ‘Weets’, and followers.
Hash tables and adjacency matrices were used to store and retrieve the data, ensuring a fast and efficient process.

projects.title: Maze 2
projects.category: Module: CS118 - Programming for Computer Scientists
projects.one_line: This task built on Maze 1 and required the robot to carry out a depth-first search in order to find the target. A stack was used to allow the robot to efficiently backtrack and find a correct route.
info: This task built on Maze 1 and required the robot to carry out a depth-first search in order to find the target.
I used a stack to allow the robot to efficiently backtrack and find a correct route.
After the depth-first search, the robot is able to use the stack to navigate a clear route to the target.
As an additional feature, I created a program which allowed the user to control the robot using a keyboard.

projects.title: Maze 1
projects.category: Module: CS118 - Programming for Computer Scientists
projects.one_line: This project allows a robot to navigate through a randomly generated maze. The robot needed to avoid crashing into walls and pick the correct route to move towards the target.
info: In this project, I had to write a program in Java to navigate a robot through a randomly generated maze.
The robot needed to avoid crashing into walls and pick the correct route to move towards the target.
In the event multiple moves made the robot move towards the target, a random move was chosen.

projects.title: Tic Tac Toe
projects.one_line: A implementaion of the familiar game 'Noughts & Crosses' as an Android App.
info: In this project, I created the familiar game Tic TacToe in Android Studio using Java.
The app allows two users to play the game, alert the winner of the game, keep score of the game and allows the game to be reset.
As my first project using Android Studio, this task was mainly to improve my basic Java skills and produce a Android APK.

projects.title: Nuffield Foundation Placement
projects.one_line: A Research Placement by the Nuffield Foundation and the University of Northampton. My research involved learning how to use a Robot Arm using Python & developing a set of task for younger students to learn about programming.
info: During the Summer, I took part in a Nuffield Foundation Research Placement, where I had to program a Robot Arm to carry out various movements in Python and designed an interactive set of tasks for younger students to learn about programming using this Robot Arm.

Furthermore, I had to plan, prepare and deliver a presentation and report about my research project to a selection of Computer Science experts, which further developed my communication skills and self-confidence.
received the Gold CREST Award for my research into Robotics.
